DOC.HEADLINE: US paper names woman journalist abducted in Iraq

TEXT.S: US paper names woman journalist abducted in Iraq
The Christian Science Monitor on Monday named a US journalist kidnapped in Iraq as freelancer Jill Carroll, who was on assignment for the US-based paper when she was seized.
Carroll was abducted in western Baghdad on Saturday, by kidnappers who killed her Iraqi interpreter, the paper said in a statement, calling for her release.
The incident had previously been reported from Baghdad, but Carroll had not been identified.
